name: BatchCreateReferences
description:
Batch create cross-references between items in a collection.

Use this tool to efficiently establish multiple cross-references between items in a collection at once. Ideal for handling large datasets where establishing individual links manually would be inefficient.

parameters.name: reference_batch_list
parameters.description: A list of references to batch, with each comprising 'from', 'to', and optional 'tenant'. Use the URI format specified in the API documentation.

from.description: Long-form beacon-style URI to identify the source of the cross-reference, including the property name. Should be in the form of `weaviate://localhost/objects/<uuid>/<className>/<propertyName>`, where `<className>` and `<propertyName>` must represent the cross-reference property of the source class to be used.

to.description: Short-form URI to point to the cross-reference. Should be in the form of `weaviate://localhost/<uuid>` for the example of a local cross-reference to an object.

value_schema.description: A list of references to be batched. The ideal size depends on the used database connector. Please see the documentation of the used connector for help.

parameters.name: consistency_level
parameters.description: Specifies the number of replicas needed to acknowledge a request for it to be deemed successful.

value_schema.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the weaviate API.

parameters.name: consistency_level
parameters.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

value_schema.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

value_schema.description: A list of references to be batched. The ideal size depends on the used database connector. Please see the documentation of the used connector for help.
